Buckle Up! Boxer Vijender Singh Will Next Fight In November, Defend His Unbeaten 11-Match Streak

Buckle Up! Boxer Vijender Singh Will Next Fight In November, Defend His Unbeaten 11-Match Streak

After a dream start to his professional career, Vijender Singh will be back in action to face his next opponent on November 22 in Dubai.

PTI

Being undefeated in his 11 career professional fights, Vijender has made quite an impact and will now be in action in Dubai. The opponent of his 12th fight is yet to be decided.

The unbeaten Vijender (11-0, 8 KOs) will look to extend his unbeaten record on a card promoted by Round 10 Boxing and MTK Global, in association with Top Rank -- the Indian's promoters in the USA.

He has been so dominant on the circuit that eights of his wins have been via knockout. He has shown tremendous agility, adaptability and has been silk with his punches.

AFP

He was last seen in action in July when he defeated Mike Snider via Technical Knockout in his US debut fight. After turning pro in 2015, Vijender has been making waves in the circuit and performing admirably.

The hard-hitting super-middleweight is currently training in Manchester under his trainer Lee Beard, a press release from the organisers stated.

Getty Images

"This is a wonderful opportunity for me to showcase my skills and to keep active as I continue my world title quest," Vijender said.

"I was proud of my last performance back in July, but I was coming off a long layoff. I am rounding into form, and fans are going to see the best version of Vijender Singh when I fight in Dubai," he added.

The current WBO Asia Pacific Super Middleweight Champion and WBO Oriental Super Middleweight Champion will be looking to extending his unbeaten run to 12 matches.

(With Inputs From PTI)
